channel.title: Staff Command Message Problem
channel.description: Okay, well I'm just starting to code Rsps's. I've been trying to make my server's ::master and ::pure commands to be Mod+. The problem occurs with the message. Every time I attempt to add a message tell the player that "This command is Staff-Only.", that message appears with every command that I enter. I have TeamViewer if it's necessary, but I really need the help. Thanks!

item.title: Staff Command Message Problem
item.dc:creator: @iii_jake_iii iii jake iii
item.description:
@iii_jake_iii wrote:

This is another Option For Master And Pure all you really have to do is put your name where is says c.playerName.equalsIgnoreCase. If You Want to add more names just do this: if (c.playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“NAME HERE”) || c.playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“NAME HERE”), Make sure to add “) {” at the end Here they are: if (playerCommand.startsWith("master")) { if (c.inWild()) return; for (int j = 0; j < 7; j++) { if (c.playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("NAME HERE")) { c.getItems().addItem(995, 2147000000); c.pkPoints = 50000; } c.playerXP[j] = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(99)+5; c.playerLevel[j] = c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[j]); c.getPA().refreshSkill(j); } }
Heres Pure:

if (playerCommand.startsWith("pure")) { if (c.inWild()) return; c.playerXP[0] = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(99)+5; c.playerLevel[0] = c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[0]); c.getPA().refreshSkill(0); c.playerXP[2] = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(99)+5; c.playerLevel[2] = c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[2]); c.getPA().refreshSkill(2); c.playerXP[3] = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(99)+5; c.playerLevel[3] = c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[3]); c.getPA().refreshSkill(3); c.playerXP[4] = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(99)+5; c.playerLevel[4] = c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[4]); c.getPA().refreshSkill(4); c.playerXP[6] = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(99)+5; c.playerLevel[6] = c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[6]); c.getPA().refreshSkill(6); }

Read full topic

item.title: Staff Command Message Problem
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

Lmao my bad.

Try this.

if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("master") && c.pure == 0 && c.playerRights >= 3) { for (int i = 0; i < 24; i++) { c.playerLevel[i] = 99; c.playerXP[i] = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(100); c.getPA().refreshSkill(i); c.pure = 1; } c.getPA().requestUpdates(); } else if (c.playerRights == 0) { c.sendMessage("This command is Staff-Only."); }

Read full topic

item.title: Staff Command Message Problem
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

if (command.equals("master") && rights >= 1) {
    for (int i = 0; i <= 6; i++) {
        c.getPA().addSkillXP(Integer.MAX_VALUE, i);
    }
    // refresh skills
}

Read full topic

item.title: Staff Command Message Problem
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

Use this. To help you learn more, use loops, and I added some sidenotes

if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("master") && c.pure == 0 && c.playerRights >= 3) { for (int i = 0; i < 24; i++) {// this is an example of a loop. c.playerLevel[i] = 99; c.playerXP[i] = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(100); c.getPA().refreshSkill(i); c.pure = 1; } c.getPA().requestUpdates(); } else if (c.playerRights == 1) { // you did this part right but forgot the else. c.sendMessage("This command is Staff-Only."); }

Read full topic

item.title: Staff Command Message Problem
item.dc:creator: @Rectification Rectification
item.description:
@Rectification wrote:

if (playerCommand.startsWith("master") && c.pure == 0 && c.playerRights >= 1) { int i = 0; c.getPA().addSkillXP((15000000), 0); c.getPA().addSkillXP((15000000), 1); c.getPA().addSkillXP((15000000), 2); c.getPA().addSkillXP((15000000), 3); c.getPA().addSkillXP((15000000), 4); c.getPA().addSkillXP((15000000), 5); c.getPA().addSkillXP((15000000), 6); c.playerXP[3] = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(99)+5; c.playerLevel[3] = c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[3]); c.getPA().refreshSkill(3); c.pure = 1; }if (c.playerRights < 1) { c.sendMessage("This command is Staff-Only.") }

I’m new at coding, so I’m expecting a simple fix to this.

Read full topic
